title: Claude Monet

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

publication_history:
M. B. W., "Portrait of Monet by André," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 17 no. 3 (March 1923): 32-33 (ill.).

"Accessions and Loans," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 17 no. 3 (March 1923): 35.

Art Institute of Chicago Newsletter (December 1921-December 1923): 127 no. 5.

“Andre’s ‘Monet’ for Chicago Institute,” Art News 21 (February 17, 1923): 1.

Muriel Ciolkowska, “The Art of André,” International Studio 76 (1923) plate opp. 455 (color ill.).

M. C., "Monets in the Art Institute," Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 19, no. 2 (1925): 18 (ill.), 21.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Chicago: Art Institute: 1925), 74, 125 no. 620, as Claude Monet (in his Garden at Giverny).

Marius Mermillon, Albert André (Paris: G. Crès & cie, c. 1927) plate 37.

Art Institute of Chicago, A Guide to the Paintings in the Permanent Collection (Chicago: Art Institute: 1932) 75, 141, as Claude Monet (in his Garden at Giverny).

Pictures on Exhibit 8, no. 10 (July 1946): 2 (ill.).

A. C., “Homage to Claude Monet,” The Art Institute of Chicago Quarterly LI, no. 2 (April 1, 1957): 28 (ill.).

“Monet and the Giverny Group,” Bulletin of the Dayton Art Institute, 19, no. 3 (December 1960) n.p. (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in the Art Institute: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 1961), 15.

A. James Speyer, Twentieth-Century European Paintings, compiled by Courtney Graham Donnell. (Chicago and London: The University of Chicago Press, 1980), 13, 31 no. 1A4, plate 1A4.

Evelyne Yeatman, Albert André (Association pour létude de l'oeuvre d'Albert André, 1990), 29 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Dayton, Ohio, Dayton Art Institute, Monet and the Giverny Group, Jan. 6 – Feb. 12, 1961, cat. 1; Davenport, Iowa, Municipal Art Gallery, Mar. 11 – Apr. 5, 1961; Tucson, University of Arizona, Apr. 19 – May 10, 1961; Reno, University of Nevada, Oct. 21–Nov. 11, 1961; San Diego, California, Fine Arts Gallery, Nov. 30 – Dec. 23, 1961; Atlanta, Georgia, Atlanta Art Association, Jan. 7–28, 1962.

Short term loan to Mr. and Mrs. B.E. Bensinger, Chicago, January 17 – April 6, 1973.

Short term loan to Mr. and Mrs. B.E. Bensinger, Chicago, April 18 – May 18, 1973.
provenance_text: The artist; sold to Durand-Ruel, Paris, July, 20, 1922 [this and the following according to correspondence with France Daguet, Durand-Ruel & Cie., Mar. 7, 1986, in curatorial object file]; sent to Galerie Durand-Ruel, New York, Nov. 2, 1922; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, Feb. 14, 1923.
